title: ISU organises seminar on public health career
body: International Standard University hosted a seminar titled Public Health Career: Scope and Opportunities on its Mohakhali campus in Dhaka on Thursday. The event was organised by the university’s master of public health programme, said a press release. Professor Muhammad Aziz Rahman, professor of public health and associate dean, research, at the Federation University, Australia, and vice-president of the Public Health Association of Australia, attended the seminar as keynote speaker. Aziz Rahman emphasised the critical importance of research-driven approaches in public health, stating that policies, programmes and interventions must be grounded in scientific evidence to accurately identify community health challenges and develop effective, sustainable solutions. He noted, ‘Public health is not only a field of professional advancement but also a meaningful avenue for contributing to social welfare and national development.’ The session was presided over by Fahmida Binte Mesbah, head of the department of public health at ISU. Professor Md Abul Kashem, dean of the faculty of engineering and technology, delivered welcome remarks at the seminar. Also, present were Professor Md Ekramul Hoque, director of IQAC; public health expert Professor Shahanaz Chowdhury; ISU registrar Mohammad Faizullah Kawshik; along with chairpersons of various departments, faculty members and administrative officials.
